title: The Standard Announces Leadership Team and Organizational Changes

organizations.name: individual disability insurance and corporate marketing
individual disability insurance and corporate marketing and communications

text:
Katherine Durham, Vice President of Individual Disability Insurance and Corporate Marketing and Communications, to Retire in May
PORTLAND, Ore.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Standard Insurance Company (The Standard) today announced a series of leadership team and organizational changes to support its strategies for future innovation and growth. The company also announced that Katherine Durham, vice president, Individual Disability Insurance and Corporate Marketing and Communications, will retire in May.
“I’m pleased to announce these leadership changes because they represent the dividends of our focus on leadership development,” said Greg Ness, chairman, president and chief executive officer of The Standard. “Having a pipeline of leaders of this caliber allows us to quickly pivot to meet the evolving needs of our customers and a rapidly changing benefits marketplace,” Ness said.
Floyd Chadee, currently senior vice president and chief financial officer, will assume leadership of the company’s M&A strategy, the Individual Disability Insurance business line, as well as The Standard’s relationship with parent organization, Meiji Yasuda Life Insurance Company.
Dawn McMaster, currently vice president of Individual Disability Insurance, will assume a new role as vice president, Guaranteed Standard Issue Business Development, and will report to Rick Johnstone, vice president, Employee Benefit Sales.
Jeremy Horner, currently assistant vice president, Corporate Accounting, will become assistant vice president, Individual Disability Insurance, and report to Floyd Chadee.
Sally Manafi, currently vice president and corporate actuary, has been promoted to vice president and chief risk officer.
Rob Erickson, currently vice president, Corporate Finance and Controller, has been promoted to vice president and chief accounting officer.
Corporate Communications will become part of a broader corporate organization that includes Public Affairs, Government Relations and Philanthropy, reporting to Justin Delaney, vice president & associate counsel. Amy Malagamba, second vice president, will continue to lead the Corporate Communications team.
Dina Khoury, currently assistant vice president, Corporate Marketing Strategy and Planning, has been promoted to vice president, Marketing, and will lead the corporate marketing team following Katherine Durham’s retirement.
“Katherine has been an integral part of our senior leadership team for eight years, and her wisdom and talents – both as a marketer and a business leader – will be missed. We wish her well-deserved success in her next chapter,” said Ness.
Durham has served as The Standard’s vice president of Corporate Marketing and Communications since 2010. In 2013, she also assumed responsibility for The Standard’s Individual Disability Insurance business.
About The Standard
The Standard is a leading provider of financial products and services, including group and individual disability insurance, group life and accidental death and dismemberment insurance, group dental and vision insurance, absence management services, retirement plans products and services and individual annuities. For more information about The Standard, visit www.standard.com .
The Standard is the marketing name for StanCorp Financial Group, Inc., and its subsidiaries: Standard Insurance Company, The Standard Life Insurance Company of New York, Standard Retirement Services, Inc., StanCorp Mortgage Investors, Inc., StanCorp Investment Advisers, Inc., StanCorp Real Estate, LLC, and StanCorp Equities, Inc.
